alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 16 at 5:18AM CDT until June 16 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Baldwin. In northwest Florida, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 AM CDT, Radar indicated a few rain showers but the heavier rains have ended for the time being. Repeated rounds of showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall fell across much of south central Baldwin county and far southwestern Escambia county overnight. Radar estimates that 4 to 8 inches of rain with higher totals over 10 inches in some places fell overnight. Inundation flooding will likely continue through the early morning hours. If additional heavy rains redevelop, another Flash Flood Warning will become necessary. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Robertsdale, Loxley, Lillian, Silverhill, Elsanor, Rosinton, Seminole, Perdido Heights, Paradise Beach, Belforest and Pleasant Grove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
